snippet: Cardinal Carlo Maria Martini, the Italian cleric who died Friday at 85, was once favored by Vatican progressives to succeed Pope John Paul II.
lead_paragraph: Cardinal Carlo Maria Martini, the Italian cleric who died Friday at 85, was once favored by Vatican progressives to succeed Pope John Paul II.

headline.seo: Cardinal Carlo Martini Criticized Church Soon Before Death
headline.main: Cardinal Called Church ‘200 Years Out of Date’ Soon Before Death
headline.print_headline: Cardinal Called Church ‘200 Years Out of Date’ Soon Before Death
